meanings.definition: To change the direction or position of something
meanings.sent1: She reorientated the map to face north.
meanings.sent2: After getting lost, he reorientated himself and found his way back.
meanings.sent3: The confused cat reorientated itself after spinning in circles.
meanings.sent4: The dancer reorientated her body gracefully during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The compass needle reorientated itself towards the magnetic north pole.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new situation or environment
meanings.sent1: He reorientated his study habits to succeed in the new school.
meanings.sent2: The team reorientated their strategy to meet the changing market demands.
meanings.sent3: The robot reorientated its sensors to detect the approaching danger.
meanings.sent4: She reorientated her mindset to embrace the challenges ahead.
meanings.sent5: The plant reorientated its leaves to capture more sunlight for photosynthesis.
